pages.text:
Our Team: Our Team
Amanda Walsh
The Owner
Amanda Walsh started Cheeser's Palace Cafè with her mother Carol Kayser in 2004. After her mother's retirement in 2010 Amanda became the sole proprietor. Amanda has served on the board for March of Dimes, and the South Lake Chamber of Commerce, chaired the teacher's appreciation breakfast, and has participated in many other boards. During COVID-19 she helped coordinate and distribute meals to those affected by the virus. Her hobbies include amateur photography, loving horse owner, and being a happy mother and wife. She has a passion for food and helping   those around her.
Isela García
Kitchen Manager
Isela Garcia joined our team in 2012, starting as a dishwasher, and she quickly rose to the position of Assistant Kitchen Manager in 3 years. Now she runs the kitchen staff and handles most of the chocolate work. She is also a part-time college student at the University of Central Florida, working towards her Bachelor's Degree in Accounting. We couldn't be more excited about being a part of her future!
Emm
a
Aka the "Cheerleader"
What's a food you couldn't stand as a kid but now you can't live without?
Tell your visitors your story. Add catchy text to describe what you do, and what you have to offer. The right words can inspire and intrigue your audience, so they’re ready to take action on your site. To start telling your story, double click or click Edit Text.
Lemon Blueberry muffins
If we named a special after you what would it be?
The Cheerleader Special would be Lemon, Blueberry, and Ricotta
What's a food that no one could dislike (and if they do they aren't human)?
Cucumbers
Shannon
If you could eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?
Fettucini! (anything Italian, really!)
What food do you love that a lot of people might find odd?
Green olives- on anything! (Tacos, salads, pizza, snacks, and dip!)
If the Shannon was on the menu, what would it be?
Loaded Bleu Cheese Ribeye, Cheesy Potatoes, Brussels Sprouts, and Corn on the Cob!
For dessert- Red Velvet Cake!!
Tabby
Aka
"The Canadian"
What's a food you couldn't stand as a kid but now you can't live without?
Cabbage
If we named a special after you what would it be?
An all-meat omelet with smoked gouda
What's a food that no one could dislike (and if they do they aren't human)?
Cheese
Kalen
aka "The Superfood"
What's a food you couldn't stand as a kid but now can't live without?
​
Onions!!!
​
If we named a special after you, what would it be?
​
Extra crispy buffalo wings (all flats) with bleu cheese crumbles
​
What's a food that no one can dislike (and if they do, they aren't human)?
​
Chicken Fingers.
Keisha
What's a food you couldn't stand as a kid but now can't live without?
​
Avocados
​
If we named a special after you, what would it be?
​
Ham and Spinach quiche or
Bacon and Cheddar quiche
​
What's a food that no one can dislike (and if they do, they aren't human)?
​
Blueberries
Nathan
When did you decide to become a cook?
​
In the Fall of 2023, I had to escape the responsibility of winning Rookie Teacher of the Year.
​
What is your favorite food to cook?
​
Omelets are very satisfying to create. A nice full omelet looks fun to squish, but we shouldn't squish our friends!
​
Name the three kitchen tools you can't do without?
​
Headphones, optimistic thinking, and my friends!
​
If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?
​
Peanut butter and Jelly smoothies!
What food do YOU love but others think is odd?
​
OYSTERS!!!!!!!!
​
If the NATHAN was on the menu, what would it be?
​
The no-bagel-breakfast sandwich is two hard eggs topped with ham, covered in buffalo sauce, and served with cream cheese on a croissant!!
Heading 3
Coming Soon!
If you could eat one food for the rest of your life what would it be?
​
​
​
If we named a special after you, what would it be?
​
​
​
What food do you love that most people find odd?
​
​
Carol
What's a food you couldn't stand as a kid but now you can't live without?
Sushi
If we named a special after you what would it be?
Long Island Omelet
-Organic broccoli florets, fresh sliced mushrooms, crisp bacon, sauteed onions, fresh garlic, ricotta, provolone, mozzarella, and asiago cheese!
What's a food that no one could dislike (and if they do they aren't human)?
Bread
Jordan
When did you decide to become a cook?
It wasn'
t something I was directly looking for but the opportunity came and I was open to trying something I didn't have much experience doing.
What is your favorite food to cook?
Veggie burger with squash, zucchini, and mushrooms.
Name three kitchen tools you can't do without.
Knife, Spreaders, Spoon
If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?
Veggie beef tacos with mushroom, squash, zucchini, and salsa verde.
What food do you love but others think is odd?
French toast/Pancakes with peanut butter and syrup
If the "Jordan" was on the menu, what would it be?
Veggie sausage breakfast sandwich would contain veggies and possibly an egg.
​
Jacob
​
When did you decide to become a cook?
When
I got bored of being a dishwasher
What is your favorite food to cook?
Grilled Sandwiches.
Name three kitchen tools you can't do without.
Knife, Spatuala, Spoon
If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?
Watermelon
What food do you love but others think is odd?
Apple cores
If Jacob was on the menu, what would it be?
The Jacob would be a grilled rye sandwich with turkey, ham, cheddar, mustard, and mayo.
​
